title: LinoLetter 05/04 - Avenir Next, the redesigned font classic
content:
============================================================   
LinoLetter 05/04 - Avenir Next, the redesigned font classic   
============================================================   
   
! Welcome to the fifth issue of the LinoLetter in 2004 !   
   
INTRODUCTION:   
Although Adrian Frutiger has created many famous typefaces,   
such as Univers or Frutiger, another matter has remained   
very close to his heart - the perfection of his linear   
sans serif, Avenir. Together with Akira Kobayashi, Linotype   
Library's Type Director, Adrian Frutiger has completely   
reworked the Avenir type family. The result is Avenir Next,   
which contains six harmonious weight increments - from   
light to heavy - along with matching italic and condensed   
styles.   
   
The second topic in this edition of the LinoLetter is an   
explanation of our so-called CE-Fonts. These fonts are   
necessary for the setting of Eastern European languages,   
which are more important than ever due to the EU's recent   
expansion.   
   
We all know that it can be difficult to create design that   
appeals to the younger generations. In order to narrow the   
generation gap, we have created a pre-summer package with   
five comic-style fonts. Like all of our packages, we are   
offering this one for an unbeatable price.   
   
Last but not least, we would like to re-introduce a gem of   
a typeface that was designed by Alan A. Blackman, Galahad.   
Galahad is the perfect type choice for any project that   
requires a medieval feel.   
   
Have fonts of fun!   
   
   
   
------------------------------------------------------------   
   
IN THIS ISSUE:   
   
1. AVENIR NEXT: Adrian Frutiger's famous Avenir type   
 family, completely reworked.   
   
2. Linotype CE FONTS: Fonts for today's European Union.   
   
3. Five whimsical COMIC FONTS for only EUR 6 each.   
   
4. GALAHAD by Alan A. Blackman: Unusual font design   
 with a medieval feel.   
   
   
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_   
   
1. AVENIR NEXT: Adrian Frutiger's famous Avenir type   
 family, completely reworked.   
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_   
   
Adrian Frutiger has completely reworked the Avenir type   
family in close cooperation with Akira Kobayashi, Type   
Director at Linotype Library. The result is Avenir Next,   
which contains six harmonious weight increments - from   
light to heavy - along with matching italic and condensed   
styles.   
   
Improving on the 1988 Avenir, Avenir Next offers the optimal   
balance of harmony and contrast necessary in a type family.   
With the addition of the condensed styles, Avenir Next joins   
the ranks of full-fledged contemporary sans serifs,   
providing professional graphic designers with the greatest   
degree of typographic flexibility and optimal legibility.   
   
Avenir Next is part of the Linotype Platinum Collection and   
comes in four typeface sets, Regular, Italic, Condensed and   
Condensed Italic, each equipped with 6 different stem   
weights - light, regular, medium, demi, bold, and heavy.   
All 24 styles include true small caps and old style figures.   
   
Download the entire Avenir Next Family as single fonts, or   
have them shipped to you on CD:   
 [http://www.linotype.com/6-2090-6/avenirnext.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130902235436/http:/www.linotype.com/6-2090-6/avenirnext.html)   
   
   
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_   
   
2. Linotype CE FONTS: Fonts for today's European Union.   
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_   
   
Fonts which have the 'CE' extension in their names provide   
support for the many different Central & Eastern European   
languages. These fonts contain a special Central European   
Character set, complete with all necessary accents and   
diacritic marks.   
   
For more information, please view our detailed CE font   
documentation:   
 [http://www.linotype.com/9-42-9-16808/centraleuropeanmacandpc.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130902235436/http:/www.linotype.com/9-42-9-16808/centraleuropeanmacandpc.html)   
   
Check out our Keyword search to locate Linotype's Central   
European fonts (available CE font styles are buried within   
larger font families - please click on a family name in   
order to reach the CE styles):   
 [http://www.linotype.com/keyword-central\_european.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130902235436/http:/www.linotype.com/keyword-central_european.html)   
   
   
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_   
   
3. Five whimsical COMIC FONTS for only EUR 6 each.   
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_   
   
Fonts for Kids, which display a special playfulness and   
extraordinary character, are becoming more and more adored.   
Linotype is swallowing the difference to offer a special   
collection for the beginning of the summer. This collection   
features five comic-style fonts - a Comic Value Pack, if you   
will. Four of these fonts are handwriting style offerings;   
the last is a special Pi font - Linotype Maenneken.   
Together, these faces can explain any story. A fabulous deal   
for only EUR 29,50 (EUR 6 per font)!   
   
Add new life to your font collection by grabbing our Comic   
Value Pack:   
 [http://www.linotype.com/6-2108-6/comicvaluepack.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130902235436/http:/www.linotype.com/6-2108-6/comicvaluepack.html)   
   
Take a look at our list of more great comic fonts:   
 [http://www.linotype.com/52794/usage-comics.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130902235436/http:/www.linotype.com/52794/usage-comics.html)   
   
   
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_   
   
4. GALAHAD by Alan A. Blackman: Unusual font design   
 with a medieval feel.   
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_   
   
Galahad, designed by well-known San Franciscan calligrapher   
Alan A. Blackman, represents one of his signature styles.   
The name comes from Sir Galahad, son of Sir Lancelot and   
knight of the Round Table at King Arthur's court. As a sans   
serif font with a calligraphic flair, it is mainly for   
display use. However, because of its geometrically open   
forms, shorter texts at smaller point sizes may be set with   
it as well.   
   
Check it out here:   
 [http://www.linotype.com/13202/galahad-doc.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130902235436/http:/www.linotype.com/13202/galahad-doc.html)
